blog.name: andimackshitposts
blog.title: I don't have enough money for baby taters
blog.description: Semi-hiatus. They call me Tater. I recently divorced the Andi Mack canon, and remarried jyrus headcanon land where they did more with Jonah's anxiety, Marty never left the party, and jyrus is canon and also endgame.  Icon by cyrus-gayman.

summary:
Andi: Hey Jonah, are you free for the dance?

 Jonah: Oh, yes.

  Andi: Great. Cyrus, are you free?

  Cyrus: Yeah…?

 ...
body:
Andi: Hey Jonah, are you free for the dance?

Jonah: Oh, yes.

Andi: Great. Cyrus, are you free?

Cyrus: Yeah…?

Andi: Great! Because I’m not. You two have fun on your date!

Jonah: …

Cyrus: did she just-

summary: cyrus and amber are such an underrated friendship. there i said it 😤👊
question: cyrus and amber are such an underrated friendship. there i said it 😤👊
answer:
honestly that’s the truth. Cyber?? platonically OUTSOLD

Even in fics i feel like their relationship is underrated..i gotta work on that..

tags: this took me way too long ugh
but it's better than any school essay i ever wrote
this was super interesting to look into tho
title: Muffin Symbolism
body:
Dedicated to @kippenbruh​ who asked for an analysis of the muffin bet, and I’m so extra that I just analyzed every scene with a muffin in it, which is why this took over a month for me to finally finish. It also got a bit long lol

I had a couple of ideas as to what the muffin could symbolize, but the one I kept coming back to is that the muffin represents the concept of a relationship (with a guy specifically) for Cyrus.

So let’s start with the first muffin scene, the one in ‘Head Over Heels’. Andi and Buffy are both eating muffins of their own, and Andi has an extra chocolate chocolate chip one on her plate.

Cyrus tries to take it and when Andi stops him he asks if she’s even planning on eating it. She says that she’s saving it for Jonah, who hasn’t shown up yet due to the Jandi drama of the week. Andi and Buffy chat for a bit about their relationship issues with Jonah and Marty respectively, then the bell rings. Andi is disappointed that Jonah never showed up, and Cyrus asks again if he can have the muffin, and after receiving no response comments that “it’s just going to waste”.

In this scene, the muffin specifically represents the concept of a relationship with Jonah, the guy Cyrus has a crush on, and therefore the only guy Cyrus is currently picturing himself dating. Andi is keeping Cyrus from having the muffin, even though Jonah and her are having issues and aren’t even necessarily in a relationship. This is what Cyrus’s love life boils down to at this point: tragically longing for someone he can’t have. Cyrus also could have easily asked Andi or Buffy if he could have one of their unfinished muffins, but he’s so focused on the chocolate chocolate chip muffin that he doesn’t even consider asking. Andi’s relationship (or lack thereof) with Jonah is keeping Cyrus from entering a relationship with anyone because he’s so set on having Jonah and Jonah only.

Now, the first muffin scene in ‘There’s a Mack in the Shack’. Cyrus is desperately counting the number of people in front of him in line to calculate how likely it is that he’ll get a muffin.

Andi comments that today might finally be his day, and he tells her not to jinx it, mentioning that he “won’t do banana nut again.”

However, as if on cue, TJ and his friends show up and snag the last few muffins, the final one falling onto the ground and TJ stepping on it as he leaves.

First off, it’s very interesting that Cyrus personifies the muffins right away, he’s really helping my argument here. It’s also very interesting that he references another type of muffin that he’s had before but doesn’t want again, representing the fact that he’s been in a relationship before, but the person he was with (Iris) wasn’t right for him, and he doesn’t want to go through that again.

Going back to the muffin representing a relationship with Jonah specifically, TJ literally takes that concept and steps on it. TJ unexpectedly turns Cyrus’s love life on it’s head by simply showing up. While in the scene from ‘Head Over Heels’ Cyrus couldn’t get the muffin, it was still there and potentially something he could have if it weren’t for Andi. In this scene however, TJ completely squashes the muffin, showing no potential for a relationship for Cyrus with either Jonah or TJ at this point.

It’s also no coincidence that Andi comments that it looks like today’s his day to get a muffin (aka relationship) and then TJ shows up :)

Later in the episode, we get the iconic Muffin Scene™. Cyrus again is attempting but failing to get a muffin by waiting in line and it seems like his chances today are even slimmer than they were the day before.

Cue TJ again, at first only there to argue with Buffy about his tutoring, until she forces the two boys to interact by telling TJ to get Cyrus a muffin.

I think we all know what happens here, but basically TJ offers to help instead of just getting a muffin for him, and when Cyrus can’t quite do it himself, TJ steps in to defend him and Cyrus finally gets his muffin. It’s absolutely no coincidence that TJ and Cyrus’s first interaction features Cyrus finally getting the muffin he’s been wanting. He couldn’t get the muffin before because he hadn’t met the guy he would be in a relationship with yet.

On that note, Cyrus saying “you’re gonna taste so sweet” as he bites into the muffin represents the fact that TJ is going to become a much softer and sweeter character as the show continues. I believe it’s also no coincidence that Cyrus finally gets his muffin after someone believes in him and stands up for him. To get a muffin he had to be willing to make a bold move, instead of just waiting and calculating his odds. He has to actually take charge to be in a relationship, he can’t just wait and hope the universe delivers one to him. Luckily, TJ is there to help.

Finally, the muffin bet scene in ‘Hole in the Wall’, which is actually more about TJ than Cyrus. TJ is attempting to make Buffy nervous about her tryouts, but when he fails, Cyrus claims that he knew Buffy wouldn’t get nervous and that TJ now owes him “the muffin of [his] choice”.

However, when Buffy sees the girls who will be trying out she concedes that she is indeed nervous, therefore causing Cyrus to now owe TJ a muffin. When TJ wins the bet, he immediately says that he wants a blueberry macadamia muffin, and doesn’t relent even when Cyrus comments that there is no such thing.

TJ knows exactly what he wants in a muffin, and doesn’t mind the work that needs to go into getting it. TJ definitely had his work cut out for him when it came to winning Cyrus’s affection, since Cyrus was his enemy’s best friend, but he rolled up his sleeves, mixed a cup and a half of character development with a hefty spoonful of rap apology and he made that muffin his.

Thanks to the texts, we know that Cyrus actually ended up baking blueberry macadamia muffins for TJ, which adds another layer of depth to this scene. Cyrus doesn’t just give up when he (presumably) can’t find that kind of muffin anywhere, and instead decides to buy the ingredients and bake them himself. Cyrus is willing to put time and effort into their relationship and make sure that TJ gets just as much out of it as he does. Previously he had only been focused on getting a muffin for himself, but he now cares about TJ getting a good muffin as well.

It’s amazing that muffins ended up becoming a recurring symbol instead of just a device to get TJ and Cyrus to first interact. This started as just a silly concept in my head but as I dove deeper I realized it was more consistent than I first thought. I have no idea if any of this was intentional on the writers’ parts, but it definitely all added up to something significant.

Later in the episode, we get the iconic Muffin Scene™. Cyrus again is attempting but failing to get a muffin by waiting in line and it seems like his chances today are even slimmer than they were the day before.

TJ knows exactly what he wants in a muffin, and doesn’t mind the work that needs to go into getting it. Thanks to the texts, we know that Cyrus actually ended up baking blueberry macadamia muffins for TJ, which adds another layer of depth to this scene. Cyrus doesn’t just give up when he (presumably) can’t find that kind of muffin anywhere, and instead decides to buy the ingredients and bake them himself. Cyrus is willing to put time and effort into their relationship and make sure that TJ gets just as much out of it as he does. Previously he had only been focused on getting a muffin for himself, but he now cares about TJ getting a good muffin as well.

It’s amazing that muffins ended up becoming a recurring symbol instead of just a device to get TJ and Cyrus to first interact. This started as just a silly concept in my head but as I dove deeper I realized it was more consistent than I first thought. I have no idea if any of this was intentional on the writers’ parts, but it definitely all added up to something significant.

Dedicated to @kippenbruh​ who asked for an analysis of the muffin bet, and I’m so extra that I just analyzed every scene with a muffin in it, which is why this took over a month for me to finally finish. It also got a bit long lol

I had a couple of ideas as to what the muffin could symbolize, but the one I kept coming back to is that the muffin represents the concept of a relationship (with a guy specifically) for Cyrus.

So let’s start with the first muffin scene, the one in ‘Head Over Heels’. Andi and Buffy are both eating muffins of their own, and Andi has an extra chocolate chocolate chip one on her plate.

Andi is keeping Cyrus from having the muffin, even though Jonah and her are having issues and aren’t even necessarily in a relationship. This is what Cyrus’s love life boils down to at this point: tragically longing for someone he can’t have. Cyrus also could have easily asked Andi or Buffy if he could have one of their unfinished muffins, but he’s so focused on the chocolate chocolate chip muffin that he doesn’t even consider asking. Andi’s relationship (or lack thereof) with Jonah is keeping Cyrus from entering a relationship with anyone because he’s so set on having Jonah and Jonah only.

Now, the first muffin scene in ‘There’s a Mack in the Shack’. Cyrus is desperately counting the number of people in front of him in line to calculate how likely it is that he’ll get a muffin.

It’s also very interesting that he references another type of muffin that he’s had before but doesn’t want again, representing the fact that he’s been in a relationship before, but the person he was with (Iris) wasn’t right for him, and he doesn’t want to go through that again.

Going back to the muffin representing a relationship with Jonah specifically, TJ literally takes that concept and steps on it. TJ unexpectedly turns Cyrus’s love life on it’s head by simply showing up. While in the scene from ‘Head Over Heels’ Cyrus couldn’t get the muffin, it was still there and potentially something he could have if it weren’t for Andi. In this scene however, TJ completely squashes the muffin, showing no potential for a relationship for Cyrus with either Jonah or TJ at this point.

It’s also no coincidence that Andi comments that it looks like today’s his day to get a muffin (aka relationship) and then TJ shows up :)

Later in the episode, we get the iconic Muffin Scene™. Cyrus again is attempting but failing to get a muffin by waiting in line and it seems like his chances today are even slimmer than they were the day before.

Cue TJ again, at first only there to argue with Buffy about his tutoring, until she forces the two boys to interact by telling TJ to get Cyrus a muffin.

I think we all know what happens here, but basically TJ offers to help instead of just getting a muffin for him, and when Cyrus can’t quite do it himself, TJ steps in to defend him and Cyrus finally gets his muffin. It’s absolutely no coincidence that TJ and Cyrus’s first interaction features Cyrus finally getting the muffin he’s been wanting. He couldn’t get the muffin before because he hadn’t met the guy he would be in a relationship with yet.

On that note, Cyrus saying “you’re gonna taste so sweet” as he bites into the muffin represents the fact that TJ is going to become a much softer and sweeter character as the show continues. I believe it’s also no coincidence that Cyrus finally gets his muffin after someone believes in him and stands up for him. To get a muffin he had to be willing to make a bold move, instead of just waiting and calculating his odds. blog.name: my-ao3feed-trial
blog.title: ao3feed trial
blog.description: just a blog where I try to figure out how to set an ao3feed

summary: the sun will come up, the seasons will change
title: the sun will come up, the seasons will change
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2EtzyeL

by nineteenohtwo

“Where are we? What is this?” Cyrus asked.
“This is an emergency cabin,” TJ said, taking off his boots, coat, helmet and gloves, trying to turn on the central heating system in the middle of the room. “We’ll be here for a while.”
“A while?” Cyrus repeated, also taking off his outer wear, “How long is a while, TJ Kippen?”

AU where Cyrus and TJ get caught in a blizzard on a school organised ski trip, and have to stay in an emergency cabin together for a couple of days

blog.name: disneymack
blog.title: andi mack trash
blog.description:
sadie. 23. she/they. lesbian. here to talk about tv & give advice. hoodie enthusiast. fandom mother.

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

summary: if you had any criticisms or complaints about any of the major characters/arcs in andi mack, what would they be?
question: if you had any criticisms or complaints about any of the major characters/arcs in andi mack, what would they be?
answer:
I’m fairly accepting of the series as it is so I wouldn’t consider many of these complaints, but if I could have explored certain plot points more in-depth or differently it would probably be something like:

  • I would like to have seen more flashbacks of Bex. I know they wanted to steer clear of the actual teen pregnancy or the drama surrounding it which I totally get - but I think it would have been really interesting to get an episode with flashbacks of a younger Bex and Bowie when they first started dating because it would have made the audience more emotionally invested in the upcoming wedding situation. 

    I still understand why they didn’t, but it’s interesting because the new Disney Channel series coming out next month (Sydney to the Max) is going to feature flashbacks of the main character’s father in the 90′s, so it just would have been cool if that had been done on Andi Mack.

  • I would change… a lot about Jonah Beck’s character and story. In seasons 1 & 2A, Jonah was pretty adorable and his obliviousness worked well. Then they introduced the panic attack storyline which I LOVED, but I would have liked to see them get a little more in depth with that and for them to back off the ship drama with him for awhile. But now they’ve just got him kind of doing this whole hearththrob with a guitar thing, which feels like they’re just doing so Disney can promote Asher’s music and it just feels… not right for the character. Not that he shouldn’t do music at all, I actually really liked the way they started that on the show with the panic attacks, but now it’s just feeling a little.. rushed and not genuine, idk how to explain it.

  • OBVIOUSLY I would love for more in-depth shit with TJ and Cyrus, but I will literally take what I can get with that, and I can’t think of anything that hasn’t been said before.

  • I would like to see more done with Amber? I don’t know exactly what, and I’m hoping there’s still more to come but I really love her and I just feel like despite being in the show from the beginning, she still never got enough of her. 

  • Also the Walker mess… It’s all been said, but Walker was a great character and this whole Buffy thing has ruined it and blah. No thank u.

Idk there’s probably more, but those would be the main ones. Especially altering what we’ve seen of Jonah, and adding more flashbacks to when Andi was a baby or before she was born. But I’m also happy with the show how it is so yeah.
